javadoc:
Component that contains a progress bar, a progress icon, and a cancel
 button to cancel the task that is associated with this task monitor.
 By default the progress bar and progress icon (spinning globe) are visible.

methods.name: <init>

methods.javadoc: Reset this monitor so that it can be reused.
methods.name: reset
methods.comment: Reset this monitor so that it can be reused.

methods.javadoc:
Sets the indeterminate property of the progress bar, which determines whether the progress bar is in determinate or indeterminate mode.

An indeterminate progress bar continuously displays animation indicating that an operation of unknown length is occurring. By default, this property is false. Some look and feels might not support indeterminate progress bars; they will ignore this property. @see JProgressBar
methods.name: setIndeterminate
methods.comment:
Sets the indeterminate property of the progress bar,
 which determines whether the progress bar is in determinate
 or indeterminate mode.
 
 An indeterminate progress bar continuously displays animation
 indicating that an operation of unknown length is occurring.
 By default, this property is false.
 Some look and feels might not support indeterminate progress bars;
 they will ignore this property.

methods.javadoc:
Returns true if {@link #setIndeterminate(boolean)} with a value of <tt>true</tt> has
 been called.
@return true if {@link #setIndeterminate(boolean)} with a value of <tt>true</tt> has
 been called.
methods.name: isIndeterminate
methods.comment:
Returns true if #setIndeterminate(boolean) with a value of true has
 been called.

return.comment:
true if #setIndeterminate(boolean) with a value of true has
 been called.

methods.javadoc:
Set whether the progress bar should be visible.
@param b true if the progress bar should be visible
methods.name: showProgress
methods.comment: Set whether the progress bar should be visible.

params.name: b
params.comment: true if the progress bar should be visible

methods.name: setTaskName
methods.comment:
Set the name of the task; the name shows up in the tool tip for
 the cancel button.

methods.javadoc: Show or not show the cancel button according to the showCancel param.
methods.name: showCancelButton
methods.comment: Show or not show the cancel button according to the showCancel param.

methods.javadoc:
Show or not show the progress icon (spinning globe) according to
 the showIcon param.
methods.name: showProgressIcon
methods.comment:
Show or not show the progress icon (spinning globe) according to
 the showIcon param.

methods.javadoc:
Simple test for the TaskMonitorComponent class.
@param args not used
methods.name: main
methods.comment: Simple test for the TaskMonitorComponent class.

name: TaskMonitorComponent
comment:
Component that contains a progress bar, a progress icon, and a cancel
 button to cancel the task that is associated with this task monitor.
 By default the progress bar and progress icon (spinning globe) are visible.
